description: This file defines the DietaryPreferencesFragment class, which is a UI component responsible for displaying and interacting with dietary preferences and restrictions through chips. It manages UI layout, focus behavior, and modal dialogs within an Android application.

classes.name: DietaryPreferencesFragment
classes.description: A Fragment that displays dietary preferences and restrictions as focusable chips, with support for focus navigation, styling, and modal dialogs.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Factory method to create a new instance of DietaryPreferencesFragment.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the layout, initializes UI elements, populates chips, and sets focus and navigation behaviors.

methods.name: addChipsInRows
methods.description: Creates and adds chip views into the parent layout in a grid-like structure with specified columns.

methods.name: applyChipFocusBehavior
methods.description: Sets click listener and focus styling for a chip view.

methods.name: applyFocusRing
methods.description: Applies visual focus indication to a view when it gains focus.

methods.name: showMapModal
methods.description: Displays a modal dialog for map interaction.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Creates a new instance of DietaryPreferencesFragment.
